meanings.sent1: In Tanzania, you can use the kwanza to buy goods.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my dollars for Tanzanian kwanza at the bank.
meanings.sent3: The kwanza in my pocket felt like a tiny treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was worth more than a handful of kwanza.
meanings.sent5: The shiny kwanza coin glinted in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: A Swahili word meaning 'first' or 'first fruits'.
meanings.sent1: During the harvest festival, they celebrate the kwanza.
meanings.sent3: The children eagerly awaited the kwanza of the new school year.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the kwanza of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The kwanza of the story set the tone for the rest of the book.
